  • Method Details

    • verifyNumberOfTableRows

      @Then("^I see (\\d+) rows? in the (.*)$") public static void verifyNumberOfTableRows​(int expectedNumberOfRows, java.lang.String elementName)
      Verifies we have the expected, given number of rows in the given string representing the Table object. The string is made lower case and whitespaces are replaced with underscores, then it is sent a getNumberOfRows event and returns the number of rows in the table. The page object and driver object are defined by the WebDriverFactory and PageFactory objects. The derived Page Object (extends Page) should define a method named [element name]_[element type] returning a Table object (e.g. results_table).

      NOTE: Headers defined with a <th> tag will not be counted. If a row has a <tr> tag and a class of "header", it will be counted.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I see 10 rows in the results table
      • I see 20 rows in the User List Table
      • I see 5 rows in the Current Year Documents table
      Parameters:
      expectedNumberOfRows - int The number of rows your are expecting.
      elementName - String (Table name) This should be the name of the table element to count.

    • compareTables

      @Then("^I should be shown the (\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) page of results from the (.*)$") public static void compareTables​(int pageNumber, java.lang.String tableName)
      Compares the current page we are on with the page stored in memory given the page number and Table element object page for the current page. TODO: Add negative case

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I should be shown the 1st page of results from the members search
      • I should be shown the 2nd page of results from the teams search
      • I should be shown the 4th page of results from the pharmacy search
      Parameters:
      pageNumber - int Page we are on to use as a key to retrieve data.
      tableName - String the name of the table element on the page object

    • verifyUniqueColumnText

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) column(s)? in the (.*?) contains? unique values$") public static void verifyUniqueColumnText​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String isMultiCells, java.lang.String tableName)
      Verifies a column contains unique text

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Date column in the History table contains unique values
      • I verify the Contact column in the Provider table contains unique values
      • I verify the Email column in the Employees table contains unique values
      Parameters:
      columnName - String name of the column to verify
      isMultiCells - String if table has more than 1 row
      tableName - String name of the table to search

    • verifyColumnExists

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) contains (?:a|the) (.*?) column$") public static void verifyColumnExists​(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String columnName)
      Verifies the given table contains the given column

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Contact Us table contains the Phone Number column
      • I verify the Vision benefits table contains a Deductible column
      • I verify the Discography table contains the Album Name column
      Parameters:
      tableName - String name of the table containing the column
      columnName - String name of the column to verify

    • verifyStoredTextAppearsInColumn

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) column in the (.*?) contains the same text (?:entered|selected|used) for the (.*)$") public static void verifyStoredTextAppearsInColumn​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String key)
      Verifies a table column has text for the stored value.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Name column in the user info table contains the same text entered text for the username
      • I verify the Contact column in the provider info table contains the same text used for the phone number field
      • I verify the Airport Code column in the Airports table contains the same text selected for the airport's code RDU
      Parameters:
      columnName - String Name of the column to verify
      tableName - String Name of the table containing the column
      key - String the key to retrieve the text to match from the configuration manager

    • verifyTextAppearsInColumn

      @Then("^I verify( all the cells in)? the (.*?) column in the (.*?)( do(?:es)? not)? contains? the text (.*?)$") public static void verifyTextAppearsInColumn​(java.lang.String allCells, java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String textToMatch)
      Verifies a table column does or does not have the indicated text. It can check that any cell in the column matches, or that all (or none) of the cells in the column match.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Name column in the user info table contains the text Bill
      • I verify the State column in the Provider Info Table does not contain the text North Carolina
      • I verify all the cells in the Zip Code column in the Airports table contain the text 10001
      • I verify all the cells in the Store column in the Coffee Shop Table do not contain the text Roast
      Parameters:
      allCells - String all cells must match if any value is passed, if null is passed on ly one cell must match
      columnName - String Name of the column to verify
      tableName - String Name of the table containing the column
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      textToMatch - String the text to look for in the column

    • verifyColumnSort

      @Then("^I verify the cells in the (.*?) column in the (.*?) are sorted in (ascending|descending) order$") public static void verifyColumnSort​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String sortOrder)
      Verifies a table column's values are sorted in ascending or descending order.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the cells in the First Name column in the Users Table are sorted in ascending order
      • I verify the cells in the Last Name Column in the example table are sorted in descending order
      • I verify the cells in the state column in the Address table are sorted in ascending order
      Parameters:
      columnName - String the name of the column to verify
      tableName - String the name of the table containing the column
      sortOrder - String ascending or descending

    • verifyCellInSpecifiedRow

      @Then("^I verify the cell in the (la|\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) row and the (.*) column of the (.*?)( do(?:es)? not)? contains? the text (.*?)$") public static void verifyCellInSpecifiedRow​(java.lang.String rowNum, java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String textToMatch)
      Verifies that a specific cell, given by the row and column, in the table contains the given text.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the cell in the last row and the Employee First Name column of the Employee table does not contain the text Alice
      • I verify the cell in the 2nd row and the Employee First Name column of the Employee table contains the text Bob
      Parameters:
      rowNum - String the row number. Can be "la" to specify the last row, or an integer.
      columnName - String the name of the column to verify
      tableName - String the name of the table containing the column
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      textToMatch - String the text to look for in the column
